sentence.Network_en: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, many are stronger at the broken places.
sentence.Network_cn: 生活总是让我们遍体鳞伤，但到后来，那些受伤的地方会变得更坚强。

sentence.Network_en: His jaw was broken after he was hit on the head.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的头部受重击之后下颌骨折了。

sentence.Network_en: Everything breakable had been broken and scattered chaotically about the room.
sentence.Network_cn: 房间里能打碎的东西都打碎了，一片狼藉。

entry.def: Broken is the past participle of break .

entry.tran: （线条）不连贯的，断续的，中断的
entry.def: A broken line is not continuous but has gaps or spaces in it.

example.ex: A broken blue line means the course of a waterless valley.
example.tran: 蓝色虚线代表无水流过的山谷。

entry.def: You can use broken to describe a marriage that has ended in divorce, or a home in which the parents of the family are divorced, when you think this is a sad or bad thing.

example.ex: She spoke for the first time about the traumas of a broken marriage...
example.tran: 她首度谈起婚姻破裂带来的精神创伤。

example.ex: Children from broken homes are more likely to leave home before the age of 18.
example.tran: 破裂家庭里的孩子在18岁之前离家的可能性更大。

entry.def: If someone talks in broken English, for example, or in broken French, they speak slowly and make a lot of mistakes because they do not know the language very well.

example.ex: Eric could only respond in broken English.
example.tran: 埃里克只能用蹩脚的英语回答。

means.word_mean: 1. physically and forcibly separated into pieces or cracked or split; or legally or emotionally destroyed;
2. not continuous in space, time, or sequence or varying abruptly;

sentences.sentence: "tear off the stub above the broken line"

means.word_mean: 3. subdued or brought low in condition or status;
4. (especially of promises or contracts) having been violated or disregarded;

sentences.sentence: "this old nag is well broken in"

means.word_mean: 8. thrown into a state of disarray or confusion;

sentences.sentence: "a confused mass of papers on the desk"

means.word_mean: 11. out of working order (`busted' is an informal substitute for `broken');

Sentence.sentence: She walked to the local grocery store to buy broken biscuits which were much cheaper, and to get a free bone for her much loved dog.
Thanks to men like Curtice, "the bonds of scarcity" had been broken and America was rolling "to an all-time high of prosperity"
The traditional textbook model is and has been broken for quite some time.
I have to get to Manchester today and my own car has broken down.
Only four out of the 54 people interviewed had completely broken with their sisters and brothers and only one of the four felt comfortable with the break
Most of them had broken with their sisters and brothers.

jushi.english: Labour hinted it would like to resume the broken dialogue with management.
jushi.chinese: 劳方暗示愿意同资方恢复已经中断的对话。
